discussion_comments.comment_body:
The problem is that Windows 10 and Windows Server 2019 ship with PowerShell 5.1 as the default version, not PowerShell 6, so the original command would not work for most users. Consequently `-UseBasicParsing` is necessary in practice (you cannot reasonably ask users to install Powershell 6 in order to install Poetry).

About the dollar sign, it is _not_ required, I have just retested and successfully installed Poetry without. The dollar sign is actually necessary for statements, but `Invoke-WebRequest -Uri {…}` is not a statement, it is an expression. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47274532/difference-between-and.
